newsitem.title: UK: UK shares open sharply down after Wall St slide.
newsitem.headline: UK shares open sharply down after Wall St slide.

text.p: UK shares were under pressure from the off on Friday as investors worried Wall Street's near 100-point plunge on Thursday could herald a much larger downward correction for U.S. blue chips, dealer and strategists said.
"The market has been expecting the Dow to come off for sometime now," one senior dealer said.
"We're (FTSE) bound to follow it lower. But since we didn't go up as much this year, we shouldn't have as hard a landing."
The FTSE 100 index was 40.3 points, or around one percent lower at 3,950.4 by 0840 GMT. The December FTSE 100 futures contract was down 46.0 points at 3,936.0.
